reasoning: Unlimited genius enables autonomous design/iteration of experiments, compressing decades of bio/med progress.
The scenario presupposes multimodal, autonomous, massively parallel AI—effectively a 'country of geniuses.'
Abundant intelligence shifts constraints to physical/data/legal bottlenecks, making marginal-returns analysis central.
Massively parallel scientific reasoning accelerates platform-tool discovery by an order of magnitude or more.
AI design/simulation/triage shortens clinical cycles when effects are large; logistics/regulation still constrain.
Superabundant expertise makes sweeping health gains plausible, though biology and aging limits still apply.
Intelligence abundance speeds neuro tools/therapies and behavioral supports; uploading still likely beyond 5–10 years.
Worldwide access plus AI-optimized logistics/eradication campaigns makes broad health distribution more feasible.
Unlimited expert help lowers tech and policy-execution barriers, enabling high growth if governance cooperates.
AI’s regime neutrality remains; global-scale capability heightens the need for entente and supply-chain strategy.
If democracies lead amid abundant AI, they can scale counter-propaganda, transparency, and service delivery.
Cheap, superior AI erodes existing labor structures, increasing need for new distribution/incentive systems.
Reaching universal access to vast intelligence by 2035 implies takeoff began in the mid-2020s.
Such 2035 capability implies earlier milestones (insightful agents, competent robots) likely appeared by 2025–27.
Unlimited genius presumes AI-accelerated AI research and recursive improvement compressing timelines.
Achieving intelligence abundance requires/datapoints massive compute buildout and automation flywheels.
Rapid cost declines and high value from capability gains help explain universal access by 2035.
Replicable agent coworkers are a direct path to per-person access to vast cognitive labor.
Everyday life can feel familiar while capabilities are radically expanded by abundant intelligence/energy.
Cheap intelligence/energy drive uneven industry change and price shifts; scarcity goods may rise.
Safe, widespread genius implies substantial alignment progress was necessary, supporting safety as prerequisite.
Worldwide individual access suggests policy/architecture trended toward empowerment and controlled openness.
Delivering universal access implies broad distribution mechanisms were crucial (e.g., compute budgets, low costs).
